children.subject: I know 162 is heavy with the projects and 126 has weekly problem sets so I was considering taking out 188. If I’m taking 189 already, do I really need 188 as well? I hear 188 is a pretty fun class to talk early on so I put that there.

I don't think you "need" to take 188 for a grade @ Berkeley, since from what I've heard it's pretty useless for recruiting purposes, doesn't add anything to your ML knowledge if you're going to take 126 + 127 + 189, and because it seems pretty self-teachable for the most part. I haven't taken it personally nor do I plan to (given there are so many other courses to take and each technical is going to be an added commitment, no matter how light it may be).

Could be a possible GPA booster though (from BerkeleyTime, the last 3 offerings had a median grade of A-), so there's that lol.
Of course, if someone else who has taken the class and has reason to believe that it was worth taking could chime in that would be helpful too.

Personally I think the topics in 188 are tangential enough to topics in 189 (Bayes Nets, HMMs, and RL anyone?) that it's worth taking just to get an introduction to these topics so that one can then read classical sources and delve deeper into them on their own. It's not a particularly grueling class either, and the projects are really fun. Overall I don't think its worth going out of the way for, but if you have time for it you'll probably enjoy parts of it.
168 has historically only been offered in the fall.
Sem 2 seems like hell, for what it's worth. 162 + 126 + two other classes sounds no bueno.

history.content:
I’m just curious, what is your general workload/average semester like? Are you taking 2 technicals or 3 and with it without a breadth(s)? I’m considering taking 3 technicals to get the most of several classes I find super interesting. Here are the classes I plan on taking together. I want to know if it’s doable or not because it is 3 technicals and a breadth. I want to pursue the swe path while learning about ml. The ieor classes are more for self interest because I’d like to join a startup eventually. Any thoughts? I’m a second year so these four semesters would be my remaining semesters. I already knocked out the lower divs(along with Stat 134 and math 53). 

Sem 1
Cs170
Data 100
Ieor 135
A breadth

Sem 2
Cs 162
Ee 126
Ieor 171
Cs 188

Sem 3
Cs 186
Ee127
Breadth
Cs 161

Sem 4
Cs 189
Cs 168(if not, cs 270)
Breadth
history.subject: “Average” Workload
